item.title: chaos
item.description: Chaos is a high degree of sensitivity to initial conditions. To read more see the backlinks or its definition and description in the article on [[articles/computational-irreducibility|computational irreducibility]]

item.title: Complex System
item.description: A complex system has behavior that is [[emergence|emergent]] from its constituent parts

item.title: Computational Irriducibility
item.description: Coming soon, for now I defer to wikipedia

item.title: doing vs. being articles to reference
Edmund Husserl: What are We Able to Study Rigorously?
item.description: There is a powerful irony in our project. It is an attempt to formally study that which has historically eluded formal study.

item.title: Emergence
item.description: Parts become whole. Emergence is when a population of agents have behaviour not present in their constituent parts.

item.title: Functionalism
item.description: Functionalism is the notion that the hardware that a mental state runs on is not important, only the role it plays in the larger cognitive system is of consequence.

item.title: levin-email-draft
item.description: Dear Prof. Levin, This past spring, you offerred some helpful advice to my good friend and collaborator Aman Bhargava. He’s since started his Ph.

item.title: Music
item.description: This page contains lists of records that I’ve listened to, and wanted to track my thoughts of, as well as a second list that holds records that I intend to listen to.

item.title: On the Emergence of Ontologies
item.description: How does sensory information become abstract thought? What is the physical phenomena that brings about abstract thought? This appears like an [[jargon/ontology|ontological]] question but it is rather the question of the emergence of ontology itself.

item.title: Ontology
item.description: Ontology is the branch of metaphysics that is concerned with objects and the nature of being. To read more see the backlinks for articles that relate to ontological questions.

item.title: Self-Organization
item.description: This one topic is very big and very complicated. I’m very excited to get to it.

item.title: The Compass Points North
item.description: Sometimes I wonder what the ancient humans thought as they looked at the motions of the stars–as they told their myths of gods and heroes immortalized in the constellations.

item.title: The Eidos: Forms and Essences
item.description: Coming soon, for now I defer to wikipedia
